Text: Cameline ( ) was a fabric material used in the Middle Ages for cloth.

Triplets:<Cameline
1:
--------------------
<Text: Cameline:  By tradition it is commonly thought to have been originally made of camel's hair in Asia.>
Triplets:<Cameline
2:
--------------------
<Text: Cameline:  It was imported from Cyprus and Syria into Europe.>
Triplets:<Cameline
3:
--------------------
Text: Cameline:  Cameline is described also as a cloak of the Arabs made of camel's hair which is oftentimes striped white and brown in color.
Triplets:<Cameline
6:
--------------------
Text: Cameline:  The fibers were spun into yarn and produced in Flanders and the Duchy of Brabant in many colors in medieval times.
Triplets:<Cameline
